Description: Fragment of handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora, gradual curve. Clay medium, buff-brown; mixed inclusions. Rectangular stamp with Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 102, 38. Name Akesis. Probably from same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum ABC 0313.19.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0510)
